bow: advice for clingy mom or if am being clingy ftm to fifteen month old my husband and have an opportunity to take vacation without our baby for up to five days for the most part ok with an occasional night out and having babysitter so far we have only had two overnight babysitting times partly because of scheduling availability drama my husband and used to go on spur of the moment trips fairly often but now things have to be more scheduled and finding it hard to leave our daughter going on vacation without her feels like when she started at daycare and would cry everyday for two weeks straight was happy when my husband started doing the drop offs because did have to anymore it still hard when actually walk out of the house when she babysat at home even though have wonderful time and need to go out my husband misses the trips that we would take and spending time with me even when we have babysitter our time is fairly limited he chafing at the limitations is cooped up and feels that our daughter will be perfectly fine without us the person who actually babysits aside he thinks all of her needs will be perfectly taken care of and if they re not we should address it after the fact he seems to have no qualms at all about spending few to several days away from our baby he excited about the possible trip and while do want to go and spend time with him and our friends who will be there too ca help but dread leaving my baby and cry at the thought am being too clingy ve talked with other mother and they do seem mind being away from their kids um no would not leave my 2yr old with anyone other than my husband for more than day meaning like work day ~10 hours even leaving him with his daddy for days would be way too long for me they are our babies they are dependant on us would not say you re clingy traveling with toddler is super hard so get how nice it would be to go on trip without my son but it would not be happening anxious enough about going into labor with my current pregnancy and not having my son with me or my husband do like the option of my husband not being at the birth with me even more though think you re fine if it going to bug you to be away from her then are you really going to be able to enjoy it anyway can you bring her we brought our daughter to new york and she loved it she was 18 mos at the time my daughter and we have spent day night apart either as would miss her too much not everyone is the same and that okay my brother and his wife are leaving their year old with grandma to go to europe for week would feel riddled with dread to be gone so far and so long from my daughter but that just how am and know they love their little one too just do what works for you and your family not too clingy at all the times ve left my 17 month old with someone else he cried and shouted mama lot won even contemplate going on trip without him until we can have proper conversation where he understands why he won see me the next day but that ll be back etc maybe go for one night ohhh feel this way too even short hour or two is hard on me think your feelings are valid especially because its an actual vacation away for days maybe bring the toddler or compromise trip year or two from now when my kids were about and oldest just learning to write went away for long weekend to new orleans when got there found bunch of letters stuffed into my suitcase with words strung together along the lines of weluvyou and weknowyouwudneverleaveforever 😭😭 it was over 20 years ago and still feel bad do think so my daughter is and has never been away from me husband wants to go to big nearby city for weekend away and dreading it because know she will have hard time without mommy and daddy did leave my kids all night for really long time it took me really long time to leave my first with babysitter for few hours then had to travel for work and hated it even though they were with daddy then they got older and did mind so much haha they are fine with daddy now think be okay going on vacation with my husband without them but do want to leave them with anyone else figure few more years and ll be happy to do it since that seems to be the way it headed so ll wait till then do what you want and do worry if anyone else thinks it clingy they do matter do think you are necessarily being too clingy but think occasionally you need to put your husband before your child or yourself every once in while even if it is just 10 instances if it is something he feels he psychologically needs and he feels your marriage needs then it is worth it hear ya my husband and went on weekend trip about years ago called to say hi to my year old and he said mommy you forgot to take me am tearing up just typing this honestly going to go against the narrative here and say you should go if your husband wants to spend time with you and misses you you need to put some time aside for him know the mom guilt is real but sometimes we need to get away for bit and enjoy ourselves sans offspring of course you re going to miss your baby but she ll be home waiting for you my daughter is years and woyld not leave her for days she done sleepovers at my inlaws so we can have nights to ourselves about once month would not go on holiday without her maybe when she preteen go away for weekend without her go on holiday with her or staycation where sge is bsnysay everyday but back at night time in heartbeat though do think that makes my clingy person mum my toddler primary attachment figure she needs me she wo always need me being parent means you ca always do what you want my year old has spent countless overnights at my parents house without us when had my secund baby he was away from us for full days it was fine but he was sad and talked about missing us think you should build up to days away take couple weekends away to get the little one used to it why ca they spend time together and do adult things without leaving an 18 month old for multiple days op husband is an adult and capable of understanding that when you become parent you habe to give up some stuff fir while op baby is 18 month old not capable of understanding an extended seperation from both their parents not saying to ignore her husband needs but to find way that respects the needs if their child too at the end of the day it up to you and however you feel is perfectly valid personally of the opinion that vacation with just your spouse is extremely important go in fact my husband and have day trip to europe planned for later this year when our son will be almost he going to stay with my mom at our house and while sure will miss him so so much think it will be very refreshing for my husband and my marriage relationship ok stop an 18 month old baby is perfectly capable of being left alone for few days with family without having damaging them the child needs are food clothing supervision and love and leaving for them for few days is not disrespecting them no child development experts say it too young that why courts do award overnight visits even fir single night to the non primary carer until at least years old in cases of seperation you of course are free to do what you like but it does change the facts do like leaving my kiddo until she pretty verbal she four now and is consider leaving her with sitter overnight but not as toddler or baby it definitely balancing act because your marriage is important as well could you compromise for long weekend think it depends lot on what you ve done to date kiddo that age who has had frequent overnights with grandparents or other family people they re very familiar with throughout is going to react lot differently to the several days separation than one who has mostly been with his parents or sitter for short stints currently pregnant with my first so take it with grain of salt if you will but would be perfectly fine going on vacation without my 15 month old provided she were with my mother and that wasn something we had just thrown her into for the first time so to speak is your husband willing to compromise on shorter trip as starter and would you be more comfortable with that don forget too that skype is thing at that age maybe send blanket along for skype dates so that your little one can get the mom smell warm cuddles component while you see and talk to her too give it some thought present your husband with list of conditions that would potentially make you more comfortable going on trip of length and figure out between the two of you whether you can make it work but of course if it would just make you miserable stand by that he wouldn have fun on trip with his wife crying in the shower every night either my 14 month old son was fine with grandma and grandpa for week while we went on house hunting trip we maintained daycare throughout the week and he would only cry when we skyped and he saw our faces it sounds like you want to go on the trip but dread the goodbye so perhaps time it so that you say goodbye on daycare day maintaining routine will help your daughter also when talking to your little one about the trip ahead of time frame it as special bonding time with her and her caregiver during that week doing so will help you as well also struggle with leaving my baby at daycare to go to work miss her terribly during the week and count down the hours until saturday morning when we get to have special mama and daughter time have no desire to leave her for an overnight trip right now but also deeply miss traveling with my hubby if you re like me you ll probably never feel desperate to get lots of time away from the baby but it is really important to keep cultivating your relationship with your husband encourage you to talk to him about how you feel and let him know you care about how he feels too perhaps you can come to an agreeable compromise like an extra long date to explore new area of the city or an overnight stay at funky local hotel or day trip to hike new trail lol if you think courts don order overnights for under two years you show your ignorance of the law any non nursing child is subject to awarded overnight visits and your facts are literally just opinions well theu do on my country nursing or not ve read the research on attachment feel free to go on holiday without your kid oh god you re one of those parents enjoy losing your life to your child and alienating your partner there nothing wrong with the way you re feeling maybe five day getaway without your child is your idea of good time it would be for me either yes your lo would be fine if left with competent and sensitive caregiver but it would also be tough missing mommy and daddy perhaps compromise would be to bring the child along with some babysitting help personally couldn do it but tbh am stage clinger my partner and still love to travel we arrange trips with his parents that way we can go places that babies aren allowed but don have to suffer with the separation anxiety that would be induced by long trip without her my spouse had hospital stay that turned into days in distant city when my baby was 12 months old was terrified he would be distressed by being so long without either parent we had tested an overnight stay with grandma in preparation didn expect to be away more than but he was fine and was ok it wasn easy had almost stayed home and had mil go to be the support person for my partner instead is there any way you can do shorter trip like nights or have the option to leave early if things don go well yes baby will be fine take break husband aside would guess op could also use some non mom time interested to know what adult things you can do with and half year old think this is the most reasonable advice on here if you ve only had one or two nights away from baby their entire life it doesn seem logical to jump into nights away it important when you have children to not forget to nourish and invest in the relationship you have with your spouse part of that means solo time away from responsibilities oh my goodness that is so sweet and sad do know what sort of parent you are accusing me of being but if you mean one who cares enough about my child emotional development to find out what is developmentally appropriate and what is harmful then yes glad to be one of those parents have lost my life to my child and wo my husband is alienated we both choose to parent the way we do our relationship is strong and we get plenty of time alone together without the need to take holiday without our child it is possible for everyone in family to have their needs met wonder what age you ll allow the kid to go stay over at someone else house lol they ll be in 8th grade before they have their first sleepover at this rate the helicopter parenting in these responses runs deep honestly working your way up to couple nights is good idea but honestly if your husband needs some time off with you go for it your child won be in dire straits by any means if she with good caregiver that she has already spent time with it one thing to leave her with stranger to her not you that would be probably very upsetting to her but really 15 months old you re not talking about month old baby she mobile she is probably rather talkative and busy she ll have fun schedule some things for caregiver to do with her maybe go to the park or the zoo or whatever she into kiddo might actually have good time she had her first sleepover just before she turned she had many others since then never said kids should never have night away said 18 months is too young for nights away and that most experts agree that spending the night away from the primary caregiver ever if it with the other parent is advisable until years old the courts in my country wo order overnights under years for that reason do think it good idea to leave her for so long anyway it seems you wo enjoy the trip if you re already worrying as couple the first time was only overnight and he was the second time was for nights and he was never felt comfortable when he was younger this time ll be solo and gone almost week can wait everyone has different levels of comfort do what you feel is right if nights is too much right now then don go your husband needs to be more understanding of your levels of comfort in this situation having kid is conscious decision both parents need to realize that there are lifestyle changes that have to be made have now 14 year old and 10 year old twins when the twins were 18 months old dh and went to destination wedding for days wrote out freaking pages of instructions for the trusted caretakers had was worried anxious and did not want to go too was ftm within 20 minutes at the resort dh and were enjoying margaritas sitting by the adults only pool and realized it was much much much needed break that didn realize needed until was there called the kids everyday no facetime then reconnected with my dh and had an absolutely amazing time when returned home all kids were perfectly fine years later there are no residual effects from me having lovely vacation without my children the kids got to bond with our awesome caregivers and got to relax like hadn since having children know the anxiety you feel and just here to assure you it ll be ok go away and enjoy yourself we left our then 13 month old with my parents for three nights cried every day it was not the sexy vacation my husband was looking for but it did give her the chance to bond with her grandparents and us chance to reconnect as spouses without our kid in the long run it was good for all of us yeah mean not saying devoid of emotion my son is now and get sad immediately after we drop him off but we all need time away from our children as couple or even just for ourselves have hard time even going out for couple hours with friends or getting my nails done but my dh tries hard to get me to have some time to myself when come back feel refreshed and can focus lot more on my son it win win for everyone months pregnant now but when lo is here and we re both ready ll look forward to having couple nights off with dh days at 18 months how is it being clingy to not want to leave for that long oh yeah know going away wo hurt her long term or otherwise my sister is currently on anniversary vacation without her three kids and they re just fine the kids are with their babysitter who lives right next to them and they love her my sister and used to have frequent overnight visits with one of my aunts and we loved it granted with my aunt we were older but my sister youngest is two do think she doing anything wrong by him just did think feel so strongly about always being with my baby and taking care of her of course it ll advised and would drive me nuts my husband and talked about it and we are going to work up to vacations by having more frequent nights out and slowly it hard for me but also need to understand that he needs some time with his wife maybe find way to ease into it like husband take short trip with friends like camping or hunting or water park then you do short trip yourself the kid learns that mom and dad come back you have the peace of mind that baby is not stressed much then plan longer trip together it all balance we need time off but we also committed to raising well adjusted adults do what feels best for you and your child let other people judge away if they need to if you re comfortable go if not maybe take shorter trip was upset leaving my year old for days and it turned out to be great did leave her with her dad though maybe that makes difference getting away from your kid is great but not if it is going to be upsetting to you the point is to have fun and spend quality time together that wo happen if you re unhappy this is pretty much what we decided to plan thank you for the advice that sounds like great way to do it
